column4: does anyone know how to get a slave hdd to mount automatically
add it to /etc/fstab
what is the /dev/name of the drive, what is its filesystem and what is its desired mount point?
no the /dev/name, it needs to have something like /dev/hda1
do sudo fdisk -l, it has a definite name
alright where did you want to mount it, /media/hda2 maybe?
ok well make sure /media/hda2 exists "sudo mkdir /media/hda2
just go to the next line
ok so do "gksudo gedit /etc/fstab" and add "/dev/hda2 /media/hda2 ext3 defaults 0 0"
space between /dev/hda2 and /media/hda2
yes, now get out of that and do "sudo mount -a"
ok so then it is not ext3
ok try "sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/hda2 /media/hda2"
by the way /dev/hda2 sounds like the second partition on your main drive, not some other slave drive
the second partition of your slave drive?
ahhh, /dev/hdb1 right? if it has only one partition
well you know how many partitions it has on it, is it just one?
ok well remove the old mount point for the wrong drive "sudo rmdir /media/hda2" then make the new one "sudo mkdir /media/hdb1"
then run sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/hdb1 /media/hdb1
did it mount?
ls /media/hdb1
if it didn't error then it mounted, that is another way to know
ok do "gksudo gedit /etc/fstab" and change the hda2 stuff to hdb1
ok so it should be done
